1. Using the `mtcars` data, create a scatterplot of the fuel efficiency as a function of weight.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.4     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
mtcars |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = wt, y = mpg)) +
  geom_point()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](27_grammar2_answers_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



2. Repeat the scatterplot, but make the points _violet_ open squares of size 5.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mtcars |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = wt, y = mpg)) +
  geom_point(color = "violet", shape = 0, size = 5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](27_grammar2_answers_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



3. Repeat the scatterplot but with separate colors for cylinder levels.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mtcars |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = wt, y = mpg, color = cyl)) +
  geom_point()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](27_grammar2_answers_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



4. Why does the legend look like that? Fix it so there are separate colors for cylinder levels.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mtcars |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = wt, y = mpg, color = as.factor(cyl))) +
  geom_point()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](27_grammar2_answers_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



5. Overlay separate regression lines for each cylinder level.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mtcars |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = wt, y = mpg, color = as.factor(cyl))) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](27_grammar2_answers_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



6. Overlay a single _firebrick_ regression line over the points with a _firebrick1_-colored confidence band.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mtcars |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = wt, y = mpg)) +
  geom_point(aes(color = as.factor(cyl))) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", color = "firebrick", fill = "firebrick1")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](27_grammar2_answers_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



7. Plot the mean and standard error of the mean of fuel efficiency for each level of cylinder and color them _sienna_.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mtcars |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = as.factor(cyl), y = mpg)) +
  stat_summary(color = "sienna")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
No summary function supplied, defaulting to `mean_se()`
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](27_grammar2_answers_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
